alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; Dawes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:59PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Box Butte and southeastern Dawes Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 159 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Box Butte Dam, or 15 miles southwest of Hay Springs, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Box Butte and southeastern Dawes Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
